tool_description: In corpus linguistics, part-of-speech tagging (POS tagging or PoS tagging or POST), also called grammatical tagging is the process of marking up a word in a text (corpus) as corresponding to a particular part of speech,[1] based on both its definition and its context. A simplified form of this is commonly taught to school-age children, in the identification of words as nouns, verbs, adjectives, adverbs, etc.
name: Pos tagging
title: Pos tagging

api_list.name: pos_tag
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://pos-tagging1.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/pos_tag"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "pos-tagging1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://pos-tagging1.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/pos_tag"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "pos-tagging1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
